conclusion: Analyze forces on each block and use conservation of momentum to find static friction on block D.
Four identical wooden blocks on a smooth surface; blocks B and C connected by a spring; force F applied to block B.
System's momentum is conserved as blocks are identical and accelerate together.
Acceleration of the system is a = F/m, where m is the mass of one block.
Force applied to block B is transmitted through the spring, causing all blocks to accelerate together.
Static friction force on block D must balance the force applied to block B to maintain the same acceleration.
Static friction force f_s is equal to the pulling force F.
Mass of block D is m, so f_s = m * a = m * (F/m) = F.
Magnitude of the static friction force on block D is F.
